summary: CJ Mitchell is a Principal Product Manager at Amazon managing AI forecasting models for middle-mile logistics, with his team delivering $55 million in validated savings. He runs a YouTube channel called Putchuon with 65,000 subscribers focused on AI education and is building the Context Journey, a digital continuation system to preserve his thinking patterns and values for his son London. He has extensive experience across AI and product roles at major companies including Fandom, Wayfair, Walmart, and Deloitte.

relationships.name: Lola Mafe
relationships.context: married February 14 2023, live in separate homes two blocks apart in Atlanta

relationships.name: Carrie Mitchell
relationships.context: married 2014 to 2020, shares legal custody of son

relationships.name: London Khal Mitchell
relationships.context: born 2017, attends Esther Jackson Elementary in Roswell Georgia, CJ has shared legal custody with primary physical custody with Carrie, gets 1st 3rd and 5th weekends plus holiday rotation and most of summer

relationships.name: Julian Nixon
relationships.context: aka Juju, based in Los Angeles, collaborates on musical scores for YouTube channel

relationships.name: Jay Kinney
relationships.context: partner on Twin voice AI project focused on culturally authentic Atlanta speech patterns

values: two things can be true - embracing paradox over binary thinking
preserving thinking patterns and values for future generations

active_projects.description: YouTube channel with about 65000 subscribers focused on AI education and storytelling, best performing videos include Entire History of AI, Euphoria Timeline, and Groundhog Day

active_projects.name: Amazon AI forecasting models
active_projects.description: managing AI forecasting models for middle-mile logistics, team's five models have delivered $55 million in validated savings

key_facts: ENTP personality type with 96th percentile openness and 97th percentile extraversion
previously ran beat selling business called Flawless Tracks that peaked at 150K per year in revenue
worked at Fandom, Wayfair, Walmart, and Deloitte before Amazon
